c74object.name: sadam.tcpServer
c74object.description:
sadam.tcpServer
will listen for incoming TCP connections on a specified port and will send and receive arbitrary information through this connection. It communicates via pure binary data, representing each byte as a number between 0 and 255.

inlet.name: INLET_NAME
inlet.digest: Various messages to set port, IP mode etc. and send data.
inlet.description: Various messages to set port, IP mode etc. and send data.

outlet.name: OUTLET_NAME
outlet.digest: (int) Error code (0 on success). It also sends the started and stopped messages when the server starts/stops listening as well as the connected and disconnected messages when a connection is established or dropped.
outlet.description: (int) Error code (0 on success). It also sends the started and stopped messages when the server starts/stops listening as well as the connected and disconnected messages when a connection is established or dropped.

objarg.name: port
objarg.description: Sets the recipient port number. Valid port numbers are between 0 and 65535.

method.name: buffer
method.digest: Sets the size of the TCP cache in bytes. This is the maximum length of arriving messages. Note that, even if you create a huge receiver buffer, the actual maximum length of your message will be affected by every server on the network between you and the sender.
method.description: Sets the size of the TCP cache in bytes. This is the maximum length of arriving messages. Note that, even if you create a huge receiver buffer, the actual maximum length of your message will be affected by every server on the network between you and the sender.

method.name: start
method.digest: Starts listening for incoming connections on the specified TCP port. If the server has already been listening on a port, it is stopped first. Also, any pending transmissions will be cancelled.
method.description: Starts listening for incoming connections on the specified TCP port. If the server has already been listening on a port, it is stopped first. Also, any pending transmissions will be cancelled.

method.name: stop
method.digest: Stops the server, closes any open TCP connections and cancels all transmissions.
method.description: Stops the server, closes any open TCP connections and cancels all transmissions.

method.name: list
method.digest: Sends the incoming numbers as single bytes to the network on the specified port to the specified host. The first two members determine the host and the port to send the data to. The values are clipped to the region [0x00, 0xFF].
method.description: Sends the incoming numbers as single bytes to the network on the specified port to the specified host. The first two members determine the host and the port to send the data to. The values are clipped to the region [0x00, 0xFF].

method.name: port
method.digest: Sets the port on which the server should listen for incoming connections. Valid range is from 1 to 65535.
method.description: Sets the port on which the server should listen for incoming connections. Valid range is from 1 to 65535.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.digest: If non-zero, it will report activity to the Max window.
attribute.description: If non-zero, it will report activity to the Max window. Default value is (1).

example.caption: A dummy server which sends its regards to any connecting client.
